Title.evidence: Title: Single-Cell Spatial Transcriptome Analysis in a Randomised Controlled Trial of Anti-PD-L1 Therapy Combined with Chemoradiotherapy for NSCLC

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either preoperative CRT or preoperative ICI-CRT.

Participants.evidence: Conducted at the National Comprehensive Cancer Study Board (NCCHE), the trial included eight patients at UICC 8th Stage IIIA.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either preoperative CRT or preoperative ICI-CRT.

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial evaluates the impact of anti-PD-L1 therapy combined with chemoradiotherapy (CRT) on the tumour microenvironment in unresectable non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the alteration in immune environment, measured at the single-cell level.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved through predefined protocols, and allocation concealment was maintained.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Posttreatment, there was a significant increase in CXCL9+ cells and CXCL13+ T cells around tumour cells.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under Protocol Number 2022-407.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by the National Comprehensive Cancer Study Board.
